ukm:Metadata.dc:title: The Education (Student Support) (Wales) Regulations 2018
ukm:Metadata.dc:subject: EDUCATION, WALES
ukm:Metadata.dc:description: These Regulations provide for financial support for students taking designated higher education courses which begin on or after 1 August 2018. They also provide support for courses which begin before that date and are subsequently converted from full-time to part-time or part-time to full-time on or after 1 August 2018.

LaidDate.Text: Laid before the National Assembly for Wales

Para.Text: The Welsh Ministers, in exercise of powers conferred on the Secretary of State under sections 22 and 42(6) of the Teaching and Higher Education Act 1998 and now exercisable by them , make the following Regulations:

P1group.Title: Title and commencement

P2para.Text: The title of these Regulations is the Education (Student Support) (Wales) Regulations 2018.
These Regulations come into force on 12 March 2018.

P1group.Title: Application

P2para.Text: These Regulations apply in relation to Wales.

These Regulations apply to the provision of support to students in relation to a course which begins on or after 1 August 2018 regardless of whether anything done under these Regulations is done before, on or after 1 August 2018.
But these Regulations do not apply to the provision of support to students in relation to such a course if

P3para.Text: the course is one in relation to which the student's status has transferred under regulation 8, 75, 102 or 114 of, or paragraph 11 of Schedule 4 to, the Education (Student Support) (Wales) Regulations 2017 (the 2017 Regulations) , or
the course is an end-on course within the meaning of the 2017 Regulations.

P2para.Text: For provision about support provided to students in relation to a course

P3para.Text: to which paragraph (3) applies, or
which begins before 1 August 2018,

P2para.Text: see the 2017 Regulations as amended by Schedule 6 to these Regulations.
The remaining Parts of these Regulations are arranged as follows.
Part 3 introduces 2 Schedules

P3para.Text: Schedule 1, which contains provisions about the interpretation of certain key terms, and
Schedule 7, which contains an index of the terms defined in these Regulations.

P2para.Text: Part 4 comprises 2 Chapters containing provision about the key concepts which determine eligibility for support under these Regulations

P3para.Text: Chapter 1 makes provision about determining whether a course is designated for the purposes of these Regulations and is therefore a course in respect of which a student may be eligible for support;
Chapter 2 comprises 5 Sections making provision about how a student undertaking a designated course may be eligible for support under these Regulations

P4para.Text: Section 1 sets out the criteria for determining whether a student is eligible for support (see in particular Schedule 2 which sets out the categories of eligible student) and includes provision about the exceptions which may mean that a student is not eligible;
Section 2 makes provision about the period for which a student may remain eligible for support, including in cases where a student undertakes more than one course;
Section 3 sets out the rules for the early termination of a student's eligibility, for example as a result of the student's misconduct;
Section 4 sets out the restrictions on support available under these Regulations in cases where a student has undertaken previous study, such as a previous degree;

Section 5 deals with cases where a student transfers from one designated course to another, including provision about reassessing the amount payable to a student in such circumstances and provision dealing with cases where a student transfers from full-time study to part-time and vice versa.

P2para.Text: Part 5 makes administrative provision about

P3para.Text: applications for support under these Regulations;
requirements imposed on applicants and eligible students to provide information;
contracts for loans applied for under these Regulations.

P2para.Text: Part 6 make provision about tuition fee loans including provision about

P3para.Text: the qualifying conditions that a student must meet in order to qualify for a tuition fee loan, and
the amounts of loan available to various categories of eligible student.

P2para.Text: Part 7 comprises 4 Chapters containing provision about the main grant support available to eligible students in respect of living and study costs, in particular

P3para.Text: Chapter 1 sets out the qualifying conditions that must be met for a student to qualify for a grant under Chapters 2 or 3;
Chapter 2 makes provision about base grant, specifying the amount of base grant available;
Chapter 3 makes provision about maintenance grant, including provision about

P4para.Text: the amount of grant available;
how the amount of grant available is reduced in relation to the household income of the student (see Schedule 3 for provision about how to calculate household income);
cases where a student's household income is not relevant and the maximum amount of grant is available;

P3para.Text: Chapter 4 contains provisions determining when an amount of grants payable under this Part may be classified as special support as a result of the student satisfying certain conditions in connection with entitlement to benefits or credits, including provision specifying the amount to be so classified.

P2para.Text: Part 8 makes provision about maintenance loans including provision about

P3para.Text: the maximum amount of loan available;
how the maximum amount of loan available is to be reduced in relation to the amount of maintenance grant payable to an eligible student.

P2para.Text: Part 9 makes provision about disabled student's grant which is a grant available to certain eligible students with a disability undertaking a designated course in respect of certain additional costs set out in the Part which are incurred by reason of the student's disability.
Part 10 makes provision about grants for travel costs incurred by certain eligible students.
Part 11 comprises 5 Chapters about additional grants available to eligible students with dependants (grants for dependants or GfDs), in particular

P3para.Text: Chapter 1 sets out what the 3 GfDs are and includes provision about the qualifying conditions and defined terms common to each of the GfDs;
Chapter 2 makes provision about adult dependants grant including provision about the qualifying criteria and the maximum amount of grant available;
Chapter 3 makes similar provision in respect of parents' learning grant;

Chapter 4 makes provision about childcare grant including provision about the qualifying conditions, the types of childcare for which support is available and how to calculate the maximum amount of childcare grant available;

Chapter 5 sets out how to calculate the amount of GfDs payable to a student, including reducing the amount payable by reference to income (see Schedule 3 for provision about calculating income for the purposes of these provisions).

P2para.Text: Part 12 makes provision about cases where a student may become eligible for support under these Regulations after the academic year has begun.
Part 13 comprises 4 Chapters about payments, overpayments and the recovery of overpayments, in particular

P3para.Text: Chapter 1 makes provision permitting payments to be made on the basis of provisional decisions;
Chapter 2 makes provision about the payment of tuition fee loans, including provision about when the loan may be paid and the requirements to be met before payments are made;
Chapter 3 makes similar provision in respect of the payment of grants or maintenance loans;
Chapter 4 makes provision about overpayments, including provision specifying what constitutes an overpayment and how an overpayment may be recovered.

P2para.Text: Part 14 comprises 2 Chapters about restrictions on payments and amounts that may be payable to an eligible student, in particular

P3para.Text: Chapter 1 sets out restrictions on the payment of grants and maintenance loans, including provision about

P4para.Text: requiring bank account details prior to payments being made;
calculating the reduction in an amount payable as a result of a period of absence;
calculating the reduction in an amount payable as a result of eligibility ending or being terminated;

P3para.Text: Chapter 2 sets out restrictions on the payment of loans, including provision

P4para.Text: restricting payment of a loan if the student fails to provide a National Insurance number;
withholding payment of a loan if the student fails to provide certain requested information.

P2para.Text: Part 15 introduces Schedule 4 which makes provision about disabled postgraduate student's grant, which is a grant available to certain postgraduate students undertaking a designated postgraduate course in respect of living costs which are incurred by reason of the student's disability.

Part 16 introduces Schedule 5 which makes provision about loans available for college fees payable by certain students undertaking certain courses at the University of Oxford or the University of Cambridge (Oxbridge college fee loans).
Part 17 introduces Schedule 6 which contains amendments to the 2017 Regulations.

P1group.Title: Interpretation and index

P2para.Text: Schedule 1 makes provision about the interpretation of certain key terms for the purposes of these Regulations.
Schedule 7, which is the final Schedule to these Regulations, contains the index of defined terms.

P1group.Title: Designated courses

Text.Substitution: In these Regulations (and for the purposes of section 22 of the Teaching and Higher Education Act 1998 (
)), a course is a designated course if it satisfies
each of the conditions in regulation 6(1) and does not fall within any of the exceptions in regulation 7(1), or
the requirements set out in Schedule 1A.

P1group.Title: Designated courses conditions

P2para.Text: The conditions are
The course is one of the following

P3para.Text: a first degree course;
a course for the Diploma of Higher Education;
a course for the Higher National Diploma or Higher National Certificate of

P4para.Text: the Business and Technology Education Council, ...
the Scottish Qualification Authority , or

Text.Addition: Qualifications Scotland;

P3para.Text: a course for the certificate of Higher Education;
a course for the initial training of teachers;
a course for the further training of youth and community workers;
a course in preparation for a professional examination of a standard higher than that of

P4para.Text: an examination at advanced level for the General Certificate of Education or at higher level for the Scottish Certificate of Education, or
an examination for the National Certificate or the National Diploma of either of the bodies mentioned in paragraph (c),

P3para.Text: so long as a first degree (or equivalent qualification) is not normally required for entry to the course;
a course

P4para.Text: providing education (whether or not in preparation for an examination) the standard of which is higher than that of a course mentioned in paragraph (g) but not higher than that of a first degree course, and
for entry to which a first degree (or equivalent qualification) is not normally required.

P2para.Text: The course is either

P3para.Text: a full-time course,
a sandwich course, or
a part-time course.

P2para.Text: The duration of the course is at least one academic year.

Text.Substitution: Where the course is a full-time course that begins before 1 August 2019, it is provided

by a Welsh regulated institution, a protected English provider, a Scottish funded institution or a Northern Irish funded institution (whether alone or in conjunction with an institution outside the United Kingdom),
by a charity within the meaning given by section 1 of the Charities Act 2011 on behalf of a Welsh regulated institution, or
on behalf of a protected English provider by an institution that was before 1 August 2019 a publicly funded institution.

Where the course is a part-time course that begins before 1 August 2019, it is provided by an institution that before 1 August 2019 was a publicly funded institution (whether alone or in conjunction with an institution situated outside the United Kingdom).
Where the course is a full-time course that begins on or after 1 August 2019 it is provided by

a Welsh regulated institution, an English regulated institution, a Scottish funded institution or a Northern Irish funded institution (whether alone or in conjunction with an institution situated outside the United Kingdom),
a charity within the meaning given by section 1 of the Charities Act 2011 on behalf of a Welsh regulated institution, or
a registered English institution on behalf of an English plan provider.
Where the course is a part-time course that begins on or after 1 August 2019 it is provided by

a Welsh funded institution, a Scottish funded institution, a Northern Irish funded institution or an English regulated institution (whether alone or in conjunction with an institution situated outside the United Kingdom), or
a registered English institution on behalf of an English plan provider.

P2para.Text: At least half of the teaching and supervision which comprise the course is provided in the United Kingdom.

The course leads to an award granted or to be granted by a body falling within section 214(2)(a) or (b) of the Education Reform Act 1988 unless the course falls within paragraph (c) or (e) of Condition 1.
For the purposes of Condition 4

P3para.Text: a course is provided by an institution if it provides the teaching and supervision which comprise the course, whether or not the institution has entered into an agreement with the student to provide the course;

a university and any constituent college, or constituent institution in the nature of a college, of a university is regarded as a recognised educational institution if either the university or the constituent college or institution is a recognised educational institution;

Text.Substitution: an institution is not regarded as a Welsh funded institution or a publicly funded institution by reason only that
where the course begins before 1 August 2019, it was a connected institution which received a relevant payment before that date, or
where the course begins on or after 1 August 2019, it is a connected institution which receives a relevant payment.

Text.Addition: For the purpose of paragraph (2)
a connected institution means a connected institution within the meaning of section 65(3B) of the Further and Higher Education Act 1992, and

a relevant payment means the payment of the whole or part of any grant, loan or other payment from the governing body of an institution which is provided to the connected institution in accordance with section 65(3A) of the Further and Higher Education Act 1992.

P2para.Text: In this regulation, if paragraph (4) applies to a course, it is considered to be a single course for a first degree (or equivalent qualification) even if the course leads to another degree or qualification being conferred before the degree (or equivalent qualification) (regardless of whether part of the course is optional).
This paragraph applies to a course

P3para.Text: the standard of which is not higher than a first degree, and
which leads to a qualification as a medical doctor, dentist, veterinary surgeon, architect, landscape architect, landscape designer, landscape manager, town planner or town and country planner.

P1group.Title: Designated courses exceptions

P2para.Text: The exceptions are
A course taken as part of an employment-based teacher training scheme.
A course falling within paragraph (g) or (h) of Condition 1 of regulation 6(1) if the governing body of a maintained school has arranged for the provision of the course to a pupil of the school.
For the purposes of Exception 1, employment-based teacher training scheme means

P3para.Text: a scheme established by the Welsh Ministers under Regulation 8 of the Education (School Teachers' Qualifications) (Wales) Regulations 2004 or under Regulation 8 of the School Teachers' Qualifications (Wales) Regulations 2012 whereby a person may undertake initial teacher training in order to obtain qualified teacher status while being employed to teach at a maintained school, independent school or other institution except a pupil referral unit;

a scheme established by the Secretary of State whereby a person may undertake initial teacher training in order to obtain qualified teacher status while being employed to teach at a school, city college, Academy, independent school or other institution except a pupil referral unit.

P2para.Text: For the purposes of Exception 2, maintained school means

P3para.Text: a community, foundation or voluntary school,
a community or foundation special school, or
a maintained nursery school.

P1group.Title: Designation of other courses

P2para.Text: The Welsh Ministers may specify that a course is to be treated as a designated course despite the fact that, but for the specification, it would not otherwise be a designated course .
The Welsh Ministers may suspend or revoke the specification of a course made under paragraph (1).

P1group.Title: Eligible students

Text.Substitution: A person is an eligible student in connection with a designated course that the person is undertaking if
the person falls within one of the categories set out
in paragraph 1, 2, 2ZA, 2ZB,
6C, 6D, 7A or 8A of Schedule 2, or
in paragraph 4, 5, 6, 7 or 8 of Schedule 2 where paragraph (1A) applies,
and none of the exceptions in regulation 10 apply to the person, or
the persons circumstances fall within one of the cases set out in regulation 11.
This paragraph applies where
in connection with a designated course beginning before 1 August 2021 the Welsh Ministers

in assessing an application for support by a person (A) determined that A fell within one of the categories set out in paragraph 4, 5, 6, 7 or 8 of Schedule 2 in relation to an academic year of the course beginning before 1 August 2021, or
would have so determined had A made an application for support in accordance with these Regulations in relation to an academic year of the course beginning before that date, and
A applies for support in connection with
that course,
an end-on course following on from that course, or
a designated course to which As status as an eligible student is transferred in accordance with these Regulations.

P2para.Text: A person may, at any given time, be an eligible student only in connection with one designated course.

P1group.Title: Eligible students - exceptions

P2para.Text: A person (P) is not an eligible student if any of the following exceptions applies
Where the designated course is a full-time course, an award within the meaning of the Education (Mandatory Awards) Regulations 2003 has been bestowed on P in respect of the course.

Where the designated course is a full-time course, P is eligible for a loan in relation to an academic year of the designated course under the Education (Student Loans) (Northern Ireland) Order 1990 .
In respect of P undertaking the designated course, P has been bestowed or paid

Text.Substitution: where the course is a full-time course, a healthcare bursary, the amount of which is not calculated by reference to Ps income (unless it is a bursary grant for living costs);
where the course is a part-time course, a healthcare bursary (whether or not calculated by reference to Ps income).

P2para.Text: P is in breach of an obligation to repay a student loan.
P has reached the age of 18 and has not ratified an agreement for a student loan made with P when P was under 18.
The Welsh Ministers think that P's conduct is such that P is not fit to receive support.
P is a prisoner.
But P may be an eligible student despite being a prisoner if

P3para.Text: P's application for support is in respect of the academic year during which P enters or is released from prison,
P's present course is a full-time end-on course, or

P has been authorised by the prison Governor or Director or other appropriate authority to study the present course and P's earliest release date is within 6 years of the first day of the first academic year of the course.

Text.Addition: The designated course begins on or after 1 January 2028 and the only paragraph or paragraphs in Schedule 2 into which P falls is one or more of paragraphs 5A, 6B
, or 6D.

P2para.Text: In Exception 3, bursary grant for living costs is a grant for living costs made available under the NHS Wales Bursary Scheme.
In Exceptions 4 and 5, student loan means a loan made under

P3para.Text: the Education (Student Loans) Act 1990 ;
the Education (Scotland) Act 1980;
the Education (Student Loans) (Northern Ireland) Order 1990 ;
the Education (Student Support) (Northern Ireland) Order 1998 ;
regulations made under any of those Acts or Orders;
these Regulations or any other regulations made under the 1998 Act.

P2para.Text: In these Regulations

Para.Text: healthcare bursary (bwrsari iechyd) means a bursary or award of similar description under
section 63(6) of the Health Services and Public Health Act 1968 , but not a payment made out of the Learning Support Fund;
Article 44 of the Health and Personal Social Services (Northern Ireland) Order 1972 ;
Learning Support Fund (Cronfa Cymorth Dysgu) means the fund made available by NHS England to certain students in respect of qualifying healthcare courses;

P1group.Title: Eligible students continuing on a course

P2para.Text: Paragraph (2) applies to a person (P) if

P3para.Text: P's circumstances fall within one of the cases in paragraph (3), and
Exception 3 in Regulation 10 does not apply in respect of the year for which P is applying for support.

P2para.Text: Where this paragraph applies, P is an eligible student and accordingly

P3para.Text: P need not fall within any of the categories of student set out in Schedule 2, and
none of the exceptions set out in Regulation 10 (other than Exception 3) prevent P from being an eligible student.

P2para.Text: The cases are

P3para.Text: P was an eligible student in connection with an earlier academic year of P's present course, and
P was ordinarily resident in Wales on the first day of the first academic year of that course.
P's present course is an end-on course,
P was an eligible student in connection with the course (the earlier course) in relation to which P's present course is an end-on course,
P's period of eligibility for the earlier course ended only because P had completed that earlier course, and
P was ordinarily resident in Wales on the first day of the first academic year of the earlier course.
P was an eligible student in connection with a designated course (the earlier course) other than the present course,
P's status as an eligible student in connection with the earlier course has been transferred to the present course (see Section 5), and
P was ordinarily resident in Wales on the first day of the first academic year of the earlier course.

P1group.Title: Period of eligibility general rule

P2para.Text: A student's status as an eligible student in connection with a designated course is retained until the end of the student's period of eligibility unless terminated in accordance with regulation 19, 20, 22, 22A, 23, 23A, 23B, 23C, 23D, 23E, 23F or 23G.
A student's period of eligibility ends at the end of the academic year in which the student completes the designated course.
But if

P3para.Text: the designated course is a full-time or sandwich course, and
regulation 14, 15 or 16 applies to the student,

P2para.Text: the student's period of eligibility for the course is restricted to the maximum period of eligibility specified in the applicable regulation for the category of support specified in that regulation.

Where a student's eligibility for support is restricted under regulation 14, 15 or 16 so that the number of academic years in respect of which the category of support specified in the regulation in question is available is less than the ordinary duration of the present course, the category of support so specified is available in respect of the latest academic years of the course.

P1group.Title: Part-time courses no eligibility for years of low intensity study

P1para.Text: Where an eligible student is undertaking a part-time course, the student is not eligible for support under these Regulations in respect of an academic year where the intensity of study for that year is less than 25% (see paragraph 5 of Schedule 1 for how to calculate the intensity of study for an academic year).

P1group.Title: Maximum period of eligibility tuition fee loans and grants for new students

P2para.Text: This regulation applies to an eligible student who

P3para.Text: is undertaking a full-time or sandwich course, and
has not undertaken a previous course.

P2para.Text: Where this regulation applies, the maximum period of eligibility for a tuition fee loan, a base grant, a maintenance grant or a grant for travel ... is the period calculated as follows

Para.Text: Ordinary duration of the present course.
Number of academic years repeated by the eligible student for compelling personal reasons.
One year.

P1group.Title: Maximum period of eligibility tuition fee loans and specified grants for students who undertook a previous course

P2para.Text: This regulation applies to an eligible student who

P3para.Text: is undertaking a full-time or sandwich course, and
has undertaken a previous course.

P2para.Text: Where this regulation applies, the maximum period of eligibility for a tuition fee loan, a base grant, a maintenance grant or a grant for travel is the period calculated as follows

Para.Text: Ordinary duration of the present course.
Number of academic years repeated by the eligible student for compelling personal reasons.
One year.
Number of academic years undertaken by the eligible student on the previous course or courses (if the student has undertaken more than one previous course).
But no deduction is to be made if the student is a teacher training student or is undertaking an accelerated graduate entry course.

P2para.Text: If the eligible student did not successfully complete the latest previous course for compelling personal reasons

P3para.Text: one additional year is to be added to the calculation made under paragraph (2), and
a further additional year may be added if the Welsh Ministers think it appropriate to do so having regard to those reasons.

P2para.Text: If the Welsh Ministers determine that regulation 18 applies to a student, they may add one or more additional years to the calculation made under paragraph (2) as they think appropriate.
Where this regulation and regulation 16 apply to an eligible student, the student's maximum period of eligibility for a

P3para.Text: tuition fee loan,
base grant,
maintenance grant, or
grant for travel.

P2para.Text: is to be calculated in accordance with regulation 16.

In paragraph (2), teacher training student means a student who is not a qualified teacher undertaking a full-time course for the initial training of teachers the duration of which is no more than 2 years.

P1group.Title: Maximum period of eligibility tuition fee loans and grants for certain continuing students

P2para.Text: This regulation applies to

P3para.Text: an eligible student whose present course is a full-time end-on course (the course in relation to which the present course is an end-on course being referred to in paragraph (2) as the preliminary course);
an eligible student

Text.Substitution: who has completed a relevant course (the preliminary course),

P4para.Text: whose present course is a full-time first degree course (other than a first degree course for the initial training of teachers) that the student did not begin immediately after the preliminary course, and
who has not undertaken a full-time first degree course after the preliminary course and before the present course;

P3para.Text: an eligible student

P4para.Text: who has completed a full-time foundation degree course or ordinary degree course (the preliminary course),
whose present course is a full-time honours degree course that the student did not begin immediately after the preliminary course, and
who has not undertaken a full-time first degree course after the preliminary course and before the present course.

P2para.Text: Where this regulation applies, the maximum period of eligibility for a tuition fee loan, a base grant, a maintenance grant or, a grant for travel ... is the period calculated as follows

Para.Text: The greater of three years or the ordinary duration of the present course.

The greater of one year or the ordinary duration minus one year of the preliminary course (or preliminary courses in total if the student completed more than one course which is to be treated as a preliminary course).
Number of academic years undertaken by the eligible student on the preliminary course (or preliminary courses) excluding years repeated by the eligible student for compelling personal reasons.

P2para.Text: If the Welsh Ministers determine that regulation 18 applies to a student, they may add one or more additional years to the calculation made under paragraph (2) as they think appropriate.

Text.Addition: In paragraph (1)(b)(i), relevant course means a full-time course for the
Diploma of Higher Education,
Certificate of Higher Education, or
Higher National Diploma or Higher National Certificate of
... the Business and Technology Education Council
the Scottish Qualification Authority

P1group.Title: Maximum period of eligibility interpretation

P2para.Text: For the purposes of regulations 12 and 14 to 16, the ordinary duration of a course is the number of academic years ordinarily required to complete it.
For the purposes of calculating

P3para.Text: a student's maximum period of eligibility under regulation 14(2), 15(2) or 16(2), or
whether a student's period of eligibility has ended,

P2para.Text: any part-year undertaken by the student is to be counted as a whole academic year.
In regulations 14 and 15, previous course means a course which

P3para.Text: is

P4para.Text: a full time higher education course, or
a part-time course for the initial training of teachers,

P3para.Text: that the student began to undertake before the present course,
meets one of the conditions set out in paragraph (4), and
is not excluded from being a previous course by virtue of paragraph (5), (6) or (7).

P2para.Text: The conditions are
The course is provided by an institution in the United Kingdom which was a recognised educational institution for some or all of the academic years during which the student undertook the course.
The course is one in relation to which

P3para.Text: a scholarship, exhibition, bursary, grant, allowance or award of any description was paid in respect of the student undertaking the course to defray fees, and
the payment was provided by a publicly funded institution.

P2para.Text: A course which falls within paragraph (3)(a) and (b) is nevertheless not a previous course if

P3para.Text: the present course is a full-time course for the initial training of teachers of no more than two years duration, and
the student is not a qualified teacher.

P2para.Text: A course for the Certificate in Education which falls within paragraph (3)(a) and (b) is nevertheless not a previous course if

P3para.Text: the present course is a course for the degree (including an honours degree) of Bachelor of Education, and
the student

P4para.Text: transferred to the present course from the course for the Certificate in Education before the completion of that course, or
began the present course on completion of the course for the Certificate in Education.

P2para.Text: A course for the degree (other than an honours degree) of Bachelor of Education is not a previous course if

P3para.Text: the present course is a course for the honours degree of Bachelor of Education, and
the student

P4para.Text: transferred to the present course from the course for the degree (other than an honours degree) of Bachelor of Education before the completion of that course, or
began the present course on completion of the course for the degree (other than an honours degree) of Bachelor of Education.

P1group.Title: Extension of maximum period where student receives incorrect notification

P2para.Text: This regulation applies to an eligible student (P)

P3para.Text: whose maximum period of eligibility is to be calculated in accordance with regulation 15 or 16,
who has provided all the information required by the Welsh Ministers in relation to

P4para.Text: a previous course undertaken by P, and
any qualifications held by P, and

P3para.Text: who has received a notification from the Welsh Ministers stating an incorrect maximum period of eligibility.

P2para.Text: But this regulation does not apply if the notification is incorrect because the information provided by P was materially inaccurate.

P1group.Title: Early termination of eligibility

P2para.Text: An eligible student's (P's) period of eligibility terminates at the end of the day on which

P3para.Text: P withdraws from P's designated course and the Welsh Ministers do not transfer P's status as an eligible student under regulation 28, or
P abandons or is expelled from P's designated course.

P2para.Text: Where

P3para.Text: an eligible student's (P's) designated course is a distance learning course, and
P undertakes the course outside the United Kingdom,

P2para.Text: P's period of eligibility terminates at the beginning of the first day on which P undertakes the course outside the United Kingdom.

Text.Substitution: But paragraph (2) does not apply if P is undertaking a distance learning course outside the United Kingdom because
P or a close relative of P is serving as a member of the armed forces, or
P is unable to be in the United Kingdom for a reason related to coronavirus.

P1group.Title: Misconduct and failure to provide accurate information

P2para.Text: The Welsh Ministers may terminate an eligible student's period of eligibility if they are satisfied that the student's conduct is such that the student is no longer fit to receive support.
Paragraph (3) applies if the Welsh Ministers are satisfied that an eligible student

P3para.Text: has failed to comply with a requirement to provide information or documentation under these Regulations, or
has provided information or documentation which was materially inaccurate.

P2para.Text: Where this paragraph applies, the Welsh Ministers may

P3para.Text: terminate the student's period of eligibility;
determine that the student does not qualify for a particular category of support or amount of such support.

P1group.Title: Reinstatement of eligibility after termination

P2para.Text: Where a student's period of eligibility terminates under regulation 19 or 20 during the academic year in which the student completes the present course, the Welsh Ministers may reinstate the student's period of eligibility for such period as they think appropriate.
But a reinstated period of eligibility may not extend beyond the end of the maximum period of eligibility calculated in accordance with Section 2 of this Chapter.

P1group.Title: Refugees who cease to have leave to remain

P2para.Text: This regulation applies where

P3para.Text: a person (P) was a Category 2 eligible student (see Schedule 2) in connection with an application for support

P4para.Text: for an earlier year of the present course,
for a full-time course in relation to which the present course is a full-time end-on course, or
for a course from which P's status as an eligible student has been transferred to the present course under regulation 28 or paragraph 7 of Schedule 5, and

P3para.Text: as at the end of the day before the first day of the academic year in respect of which P is applying for support, the refugee status of

P4para.Text: P, or
the person whose status as a refugee meant that P was a Category 2 eligible student,

P3para.Text: has expired and no further leave to remain has been granted and no appeal is pending (within the meaning of section 104 of the Nationality, Immigration and Asylum Act 2002) .

P2para.Text: Where this regulation applies, P's status as an eligible student terminates immediately before the first day of the academic year in respect of which P is applying for support.
In this regulation, refugee has the meaning given by paragraph 11 of Schedule 2.

Title.Addition: Persons who cease to have stateless leave

Text.Addition: This regulation applies where
a person (P) was

Addition.Substitution: an eligible student as a result of being a person granted stateless leave

Text.Addition: (see Schedule 2) in connection with an application for support
for an earlier year of the present course,
for a full time-course in relation to which the present course is a full-time end-on course, or
for a course from which Ps status as an eligible student has been transferred to the present course under regulation 28 or paragraph 7 of Schedule 5, and
as at the end of the day before the first day of the academic year in respect of which P is applying for support, the period for which
P, or
the person, who, as a result of being a person granted stateless leave, caused P to be
is allowed to stay in the United Kingdom has expired and no further leave to remain has been granted and no application for administrative review in accordance with the immigration rules is pending.
Where this regulation applies, Ps status as an eligible student terminates immediately before the first day of the academic year in respect of which P is applying for support.

P1group.Title: Other persons who cease to have leave to enter or remain

P2para.Text: This regulation applies where

P3para.Text: a person (P) was a Category 3 eligible student or an eligible student on grounds of humanitarian protection under paragraph 339C of the immigration rules (see Schedule 2) in connection with an application for support

P4para.Text: for an earlier year of the present course,
for a full-time course in relation to which the present course is a full-time end-on course, or
for a course from which P's status as an eligible student has been transferred to the present course under regulation 28 or paragraph 7 of Schedule 5, and

P3para.Text: as at the end of the day before the first day of the academic year in respect of which P is applying for support, the period for which

P4para.Text: P, or

the person who, as a result of having leave to enter or remain, caused P to be a category 3 eligible student or an eligible student on grounds of humanitarian protection under paragraph 339C of the immigration rules,

P3para.Text: is allowed to stay in the United Kingdom has expired and no further leave to remain has been granted and no appeal is pending (within the meaning of section 104 of the Nationality, Immigration and Asylum Act 2002).

P2para.Text: Where this regulation applies, P's status as an eligible student terminates immediately before the first day of the academic year in respect of which P is applying for support.

Title.Addition: Persons who cease to have section 67 leave to remain

Text.Addition: This regulation applies where
a person (P) was

Addition.Substitution: an eligible student as a result of being a person with section 67 leave to remain

Text.Addition: (see Schedule 2) in connection with an application for support
for an earlier year of the present course,
for a full-time course in relation to which the present course is a full-time end-on course, or
for a course from which Ps status as an eligible student has been transferred to the present course under regulation 28 or paragraph 7 of Schedule 5, and
as at the end of the day before the first day of the academic year in respect of which P is applying for support, the period for which
P, or
the person who, as a result of having section 67 leave to remain, caused P to be

is allowed to stay in the United Kingdom has expired and no further leave to remain has been granted and no appeal is pending (within the meaning of section 104 of the Nationality, Immigration and Asylum Act 2002).
Where this regulation applies, Ps status as an eligible student terminates immediately before the first day of the academic year in respect of which P is applying for support.

Title.Addition: Persons who cease to have Calais leave

Text.Addition: This regulation applies where
a person (P) was an eligible student as a result of being a person with Calais leave (see Schedule 2, paragraph 2ZA) in connection with an application for support
for an earlier year of the present course,
for a full-time course in relation to which the present course is a full-time end-on course, or
for a course from which Ps status as an eligible student has been transferred to the present course under regulation 28 or paragraph 7 of Schedule 5, and

as at the end of the day before the first day of the academic year in respect of which P is applying for support, the period for which P is allowed to stay in the United Kingdom has expired and no further leave to remain has been granted.
Where this regulation applies, Ps status as an eligible student terminates immediately before the first day of the academic year in respect of which P is applying for support.

Title.Addition: Persons who cease to have
as a protected partner

Text.Addition: This regulation applies where
a person (P) was an eligible student as a result of being a person granted
as a protected partner
for an earlier year of the present course,
for a full-time course in relation to which the present course is a full-time end-on course, or
for a course from which Ps status as an eligible student has been transferred to the present course under regulation 28 or paragraph 7 of Schedule 5, and
as at the end of the day before the first day of the academic year in respect of which P is applying for support, the period for which
P, or
the person who, as a result of being a person granted
as a protected partner, caused P to be an eligible student,
is allowed to stay in the United Kingdom has expired and no

Addition.Substitution: further leave to enter or remain

Text.Addition: as been granted and no appeal is pending (within the meaning of section 104 of the Nationality, Immigration and Asylum Act 2002).
Where this regulation applies, Ps status as an eligible student terminates immediately before the first day of the academic year in respect of which P is applying for support.

Title.Addition: Persons who cease to have leave to remain under residence scheme immigration rules

Text.Addition: This regulation applies where

by virtue of being a person with protected rights with limited leave to enter or remain in the United Kingdom granted by virtue of residence scheme immigration rules, a person (P) was an eligible student in connection with an application for support for
an earlier year of the current course,
a full-time course in relation to which the present course is a full-time end on course, or
a course from which Ps status has been transferred to the present course under regulation 28 or paragraph 7 of Schedule 5, and

as at the end of the day before the first day of the academic year in respect of which P is applying for support, P no longer has extant limited leave to enter or remain granted by virtue of residence scheme immigration rules, and no further leave to enter or remain has been granted under those rules.
Where this regulation applies, Ps status as an eligible student terminates immediately before the first day of the academic year in respect of which P is applying for support.
Where
the Welsh Ministers have determined that, by virtue of
falling within
of the definition of person with protected rights, or
meeting the conditions in paragraph 1(2)(a)
... (iv) of Schedule 2,
a person (P) is an eligible student in connection with an application for support for an academic year of a designated course, and
as at the day before the first day of the academic year, P is not a person with protected rights,
Ps status as an eligible student terminates immediately before the first day of the academic year in respect of which P is applying for support.
This regulation applies where
a person (P) was an eligible student as a result of being a person with leave to enter or remain as a relevant Afghan citizen (see Schedule 2, paragraph 2ZA)

Addition.Addition: or the spouse, civil partner, child or stepchild of such a person

Text.Addition: in connection with an application for support
for an earlier year of the present course,
for a full-time course in relation to which the present course is a full-time end-on course, or
for a course from which Ps status as an eligible student has been transferred to the present course under regulation 28 or paragraph 7 of Schedule 5, and

Addition.Substitution: as at the end of the day before the first day of the academic year in respect of which P is applying for support, the period for which
the person who, as a result of being a person with leave to enter or remain as a relevant Afghan citizen, caused P to be an eligible student,
is allowed to stay in the United Kingdom has expired and no further leave to remain has been granted and no appeal is pending.

Text.Addition: Where this regulation applies, Ps status as an eligible student terminates immediately before the first day of the academic year in respect of which P is applying for support.
This regulation applies where
a person (P) was an eligible student as a result of being a protected Ukrainian national (see Schedule 2, paragraph 2ZC)

Addition.Addition: or the spouse, civil partner, child or stepchild of such a person

Text.Addition: in connection with an application for support
for an earlier year of the present course,
for a full-time course in relation to which the present course is a full-time end-on course, or
for a course from which Ps status as an eligible student has been transferred to the present course under regulation 28 or paragraph 7 of Schedule 5, and

Addition.Substitution: as at the end of the day before the first day of the academic year in respect of which P is applying for support, the period for which
the person who, as a result of being a person granted leave to remain as a protected Ukrainian national, caused P to be an eligible student,
is allowed to stay in the United Kingdom has expired and no further leave to remain has been granted.

Text.Addition: Where this regulation applies, Ps status as an eligible student terminates immediately before the first day of the academic year in respect of which P is applying for support.
Regulations 22, 22A, 23, 23A, 23B, 23C, 23D, 23E, 23F or 23G do not apply where as at the end of the day before the first day of the academic year in respect of which P is applying for support
P, or
the person who, as a result of their immigration status, caused P to be an eligible student,
is a British or Irish citizen.

P1group.Title: Full-time students restrictions on support for honours graduates

P2para.Text: If an eligible student undertaking a full-time course has attained an honours degree from an institution in the United Kingdom (an honours graduate) the student does not qualify for a tuition fee loan, base grant, maintenance grant or maintenance loan under these Regulations unless the student

P3para.Text: falls within one of the Cases set out in paragraph (2), and
in each Case, satisfies the particular qualifying conditions relating to the support in question.

P2para.Text: The Cases are
An honours graduate may qualify for support under these Regulations if the present course is

P3para.Text: a course for the initial training of teachers of no more than two years duration, and the graduate is not a qualified teacher, or
an accelerated graduate entry course.

P2para.Text: An honours graduate may qualify for a maintenance loan if any of the following applies

P3para.Text: the present course leads to a qualification as a social worker, medical doctor, dentist, veterinary surgeon or architect;

Text.Substitution: the graduate is to receive any payment under a healthcare bursary, the amount of which is calculated by reference to the graduates income;

P3para.Text: the present course is a course for the initial training of teachers.

P2para.Text: Despite paragraph (1), if

P3para.Text: the present course is considered to be a single course by virtue of regulation 6(3) and (4), and
the course leads to an honours degree from an institution in the United Kingdom being conferred on the eligible student before the final degree or equivalent qualification,

P2para.Text: the conferring of that honours degree does not prevent the student from qualifying for support under these Regulations in respect of any part of that single course.
Regulation 26 applies.

P1group.Title: Part-time students restrictions on support for graduates

P2para.Text: If an eligible student undertaking a part-time course has attained a first degree from an institution in the United Kingdom (a graduate) the student does not qualify for support under these Regulations other than a disabled student's grant unless the student falls within one of the Cases set out in paragraph (2).
The Cases are
The first degree

P3para.Text: was not an honours degree, and
was awarded to the graduate on completion of the modules, examinations or other forms of assessment required for that first degree,

P2para.Text: and the graduate is undertaking the present course so as to obtain an honours degree on completion of the required modules, examinations or other forms of assessment (whether or not the graduate continues the course at the same institution from which the first degree was awarded).
The present course is a course for the initial training of teachers of no more than four years duration and the graduate is not a qualified teacher.

Text.Substitution: The present course leads to an honours degree and is
concerned with the study of the history, grammar and use of Welsh,
a course whose code and label under the Higher Education Classification of Subjects are listed in Schedule 5A, or

listed in the Higher Education Classification of Subjects in one of the Common Aggregation Hierarchy groups in Column 1 of Table A1 except for those subjects whose code and label under the Higher Education Classification of Subjects are specified in the corresponding entry in Column 2.

xhtml:th.Substitution: Code and label of Excluded subjects

Text.Substitution: ) Applied science
) General science
) Natural sciences

P2para.Text: Regulation 26 applies.

Text.Substitution: In Case 3, the Common Aggregation Hierarchy means version 1.3.3 of the Common Aggregation Hierarchy approved by the Higher Education Statistics Agency Data Landscape Steering Group and the Higher Education Classification of Subjects means the Higher Education Classification of Subjects maintained by the Universities and Colleges Admissions Service and the Higher Education Statistics Agency.

P1group.Title: Restrictions lifted where incorrect notification received

P2para.Text: This regulation applies where

P3para.Text: an honours graduate within the meaning of regulation 24 or a graduate within the meaning of regulation 25 (G) has provided all the information required by the Welsh Ministers in relation to an honours degree or, as the case may be, a first degree, previously attained, and
G receives notification from the Welsh Ministers incorrectly stating that G qualifies for support under these Regulations.

P2para.Text: Where this regulation applies, G may qualify for the support specified in the notification for such period as the Welsh Ministers think appropriate.
But this regulation does not apply if the notification is incorrect because the information provided by G was materially inaccurate.

P1group.Title: Further restriction on support for part-time students

P2para.Text: An eligible student undertaking a part-time course does not qualify for support under these Regulations other than a disabled student's grant if the student

P3para.Text: has undertaken one or more part-time courses for an aggregate of at least

P4para.Text: 8 academic years (where that course or the earliest of those courses began before 1 September 2014), or
16 academic years (where that course or the earliest of those courses began on or after 1 September 2014), and

P3para.Text: has received relevant support in respect of at least 8 or, as the case may be, 16 of those academic years of the part-time course or courses.

P2para.Text: In paragraph (1)(b), relevant support means

P3para.Text: a loan, a grant in respect of fees or a grant for books, travel and other expenditure made in respect of an academic year

P4para.Text: under these Regulations or any other regulations made under section 22 of the 1998 Act, or
under regulations made under Articles 3 and 8(4) of the Education (Student Support) (Northern Ireland) Order 1998 ;

P3para.Text: a loan made in respect of an academic year under regulations made under sections 73(f), 73B and 74(1) of the Education (Scotland) Act 1980 .

P1group.Title: Transfer of status

P2para.Text: Where an eligible student transfers from a designated course (in this Section, the old course) to another designated course (in this Section, the new course), the Welsh Ministers must transfer the student's status as an eligible student to the new course if

P3para.Text: they receive a request from the student to do so,
they are satisfied that one of the grounds of transfer applies (see paragraph (2)), and
the student's period of eligibility has not ended or been terminated.

P2para.Text: The grounds of transfer are
The eligible student ceases the old course and undertakes the new course at the same institution.
Including

P3para.Text: where the old course is not a compressed degree course, undertaking the same course as a compressed degree course, or
where the old course is a compressed degree course, undertaking the same course on a non-compressed basis.

P2para.Text: The eligible student undertakes the new course at another institution.

After commencing a course for the Certificate in Education, the eligible student is, on or before the completion of that course, admitted to a designated course for the degree (including an honours degree) of Bachelor of Education.

After commencing a course for the degree (other than an honours degree) of Bachelor of Education, the eligible student is, on or before completion of that course, admitted to a designated course for the honours degree of Bachelor of Education.

After commencing a course for a first degree (other than an honours degree) the eligible student is, before the completion of that course, admitted to a designated course for an honours degree in the same subject at the same institution.

P1group.Title: Effect of transfer tuition fee loans

P1para.Text: Where the Welsh Ministers transfer an eligible student's status under regulation 28 during an academic year, the amount of tuition fee loan payable in respect of that academic year is to be determined by the Welsh Ministers as follows

P2para.Text: Calculate, in accordance with Part 6, the amounts of tuition fee loan that would have been payable in respect of

P3para.Text: the old course, and
the new course,

P2para.Text: for the whole academic year.
Reduce those amounts by such proportion as the Welsh Ministers think appropriate having regard to

P3para.Text: the day on which the transfer occurs, and
the need to ensure that no amount is payable in respect of both courses for the same period.

P1group.Title: Effect of transfer grants and maintenance loans

P2para.Text: This regulation applies where the Welsh Ministers transfer an eligible student's status under regulation 28 during an academic year.

If regulation 31 applies to the transfer, the total amount of any grants and maintenance loan payable to the eligible student for the academic year must be reassessed in accordance with that regulation.
If regulation 31 does not apply to the transfer

P3para.Text: the Welsh Ministers may re-assess the amount of any grants and maintenance loan payable to the eligible student for the academic year, but

if no re-assessment is made, the total amount of any grants and maintenance loan payable to the eligible student is the amount which the Welsh Ministers assessed as the amount payable to the student for the academic year in respect of the old course.

P2para.Text: Paragraph (5) applies where the transfer occurs after the Welsh Ministers have assessed the amount of any grants or maintenance loan payable to the eligible student for the academic year in respect of the old course but before the student completes that year.

Where this paragraph applies, the eligible student may not apply in respect of the academic year of the new course for another grant or loan of a kind for which the student has already applied in respect of the academic year of the old course (unless specifically permitted to do so by these Regulations).
Where, immediately before the transfer, the eligible student

P3para.Text: was eligible to apply for a maintenance loan for the academic year of the old course, and
had not applied for the maximum amount for which the student was entitled,

P2para.Text: paragraph (5) does not prevent the student from applying for an additional amount of loan (whether or not a reassessment is made under this regulation or regulation 31).

Where an eligible student has applied for a disabled student's grant for the academic year in which the transfer occurs, paragraph (5) does not prevent the student from making a further such application

P3para.Text: for a purpose for which the student has not already applied, or
for an additional amount in respect of a purpose for the which the student has already applied.

P1group.Title: Transfers involving conversions between part-time and full-time study

P2para.Text: This regulation applies where, in relation to a transfer under regulation 28

P3para.Text: the old course is a full-time course and the new course is a part-time course, or
the old course is a part-time course and the new course is a full-time course.

P2para.Text: Where this regulation applies, the total amount of any grants and maintenance loan payable to the eligible student for the academic year is to be reassessed by the Welsh Ministers as follows
Calculate, in accordance with Parts 7 to 11, the amounts of any grants and maintenance loan that would have been payable in respect of

P3para.Text: the old course, and
the new course,

P2para.Text: for the whole academic year.
Reduce those amounts by multiplying them by the appropriate fraction.
The total of the two amounts arrived at under Step 2 is the total amount of grants and maintenance loan payable to the student for the academic year during which the transfer occurs.
In Step 2 of paragraph (2), the appropriate fraction in relation to the old course is the fraction where

P3para.Text: the numerator is the number of days in the academic year up to and including the day on which the transfer occurs, and
the denominator is the total number of days in the academic year.

P2para.Text: In Step 2 of paragraph (2), the appropriate fraction in relation to the new course is the fraction where

P3para.Text: the numerator is the number of days remaining in the academic year after the day on which the transfer occurs, and
the denominator is the total number of days in the academic year.

P2para.Text: For the avoidance of doubt, where the start date of the academic year of the new course is later than the start date of the academic year of the old course, references in paragraph (4) to the academic year are to the academic year of the new course.

Part.Title: APPLICATIONS, PROVIDING INFORMATION AND LOAN CONTRACTS

P1group.Title: Requirement to apply for support

P2para.Text: A person does not qualify for support as an eligible student in relation to an academic year unless the person makes an application for that support in relation to the academic year.
An application under paragraph (1) must

P3para.Text: be in such form and contain such information as the Welsh Ministers may specify,
be accompanied by such documentation as the Welsh Ministers may require, and
reach the Welsh Ministers within the time limit specified in regulation 33.

P1group.Title: Time limit for making application

P2para.Text: The general rule is that an application under regulation 32(1) must reach the Welsh Ministers no later than the end of the ninth month of the academic year to which it relates.
But if any of the circumstances set out in Column 1 of Table 1 apply, an application must reach the Welsh Ministers within the time limit specified in the corresponding entry in Column 2.

th.leg:Emphasis: Circumstances relating to application for support

tr.td: Applicant qualifies for support after the first day of the academic year following an event listed in regulation 80(2) or 81(3) or paragraph 4(2) of Schedule 5.
No later than the end of the period of nine months beginning with the day on which the event occurs.
Application is for a tuition fee loan, maintenance loan or Oxbridge college fee loan.
No later than one month before the end of the academic year to which the application relates.
Application is for an additional amount of tuition fee loan under regulation 42, maintenance loan under regulation 60 or Oxbridge college fee loan under paragraph 6(2) of Schedule 5.
Application is for a disabled student's grant.
Application must reach the Welsh Ministers as soon as is reasonably practicable.
The Welsh Ministers think that, having regard to the circumstances of a particular case, it is appropriate to extend the time limit for making an application.
No later than the date specified in writing by the Welsh Ministers in the particular case.

P1group.Title: Welsh Ministers' decision on an application

P2para.Text: The Welsh Ministers may take any steps and make any inquiries as they think necessary to make a decision on an application under regulation 32.
Those steps may include requiring the applicant to provide further information or documentation.
The Welsh Ministers may make a provisional decision on an application under regulation 32 (see regulation 82 for provision about payments made on the basis of a provisional decision).
A decision on an application made by the Welsh Ministers after a provisional decision has been made may

P3para.Text: confirm the provisional decision, or
substitute it with a different decision.

P2para.Text: The Welsh Ministers must notify the applicant of a decision (including a provisional decision) on an application under regulation 32.
The notification must state

P3para.Text: whether the Welsh Ministers consider the applicant to be an eligible student,
if so, whether the eligible student qualifies for support in relation to the academic year,
if the student does qualify, the category of support for which the student qualifies and the amount payable for the academic year,
if the support includes a disabled student's grant, a breakdown of that grant specifying the amount payable in respect of each type of expenditure mentioned in regulation 63(2), and
in the case of a provisional decision, the fact that the decision is provisional and the consequences of that fact.

Text.Addition: This regulation applies where
a person (P) makes an application for support in accordance with regulation 32,
any information or documentation provided by P in, or in connection with, the application is not materially inaccurate, and
P receives notification from the Welsh Ministers under regulation 34(5) incorrectly stating that P is an eligible student.
Despite the notification incorrectly stating that P is an eligible student, the Welsh Ministers may, for the purposes of these Regulations, treat P as being an eligible student.

P1group.Title: Requirements on eligible students to provide information

P2para.Text: An eligible student must, as soon as reasonably practicable after being requested to do so, provide the Welsh Ministers with such information or documentation as the Welsh Ministers may require

P3para.Text: for the purposes of determining

P4para.Text: the eligibility of a student;
whether a student qualifies for a particular category of support;
the amount of support payable to a student;
whether an overpayment has been made to a student;

P3para.Text: for any purpose relating to the recovery of an overpayment;
for any purpose relating to the repayment of a loan;
for any other purpose related to these Regulations that the Welsh Ministers think appropriate.

P2para.Text: A request under paragraph (1) may include requesting sight of an eligible student's

P3para.Text: valid passport issued by the state of which that student is a national,
valid national identity card, or
birth certificate.

P2para.Text: Where an event mentioned in paragraph (4) occurs in respect of an eligible student, the student must inform the Welsh Ministers as soon as is reasonably practicable after the event occurs.
The events are

P3para.Text: the student withdraws from, abandons or is expelled from the present course;
the student transfers to another course (whether at the same or at a different institution);
the student otherwise ceases to undertake the present course and does not intend to or is not permitted to continue it for the remainder of the academic year;
the student is absent from the present course for

P4para.Text: more than 60 days due to illness, or
for any period for any other reason;

P3para.Text: the month for the start or completion of the present course changes;
the student's home or term-time

P4para.Text: address,
telephone number, or
email address,

P3para.Text: changes.

P2para.Text: Information or documentation that is required to be provided to the Welsh Ministers under these Regulations must be provided in such form as the Welsh Ministers may specify.
The Welsh Ministers may require that

P3para.Text: an application under regulation 32;
any other documentation provided to them under these Regulations,

P2para.Text: must be signed in such manner (including electronically) as they may specify.

The reference to an eligible student in paragraph (1) is to be treated as including a person who makes an application under regulation 32 even if the Welsh Ministers' decision on the application is that the person is not an eligible student.
See regulation 20 for provision about the consequences of failing to comply with a requirement imposed by this regulation.

P1group.Title: Requirement to enter into a contract for a loan

P2para.Text: An eligible student may not receive a tuition fee loan or maintenance loan under these Regulations unless the student enters into a contract for the loan with the Welsh Ministers.
The contract

P3para.Text: must be in such form and on such terms, and
may be required to be signed in such manner (including electronically),

P2para.Text: as the Welsh Ministers specify.
The contract may require the eligible student to repay a loan by a particular method.
Where the Welsh Ministers have requested the student's agreement as to the method of repayment, they may withhold any payment of a maintenance loan until the student provides what has been requested.

P1group.Title: Requirement on academic authority to notify when student leaves course

P1para.Text: Where a tuition fee loan is payable to an eligible student

P3para.Text: who has ceased to undertake the present course during the academic year, and
whom the academic authority has determined or agreed will not return during that year,

P1para.Text: the academic authority must inform the Welsh Ministers as soon as reasonably practicable that the student has ceased to undertake the course.

P1group.Title: Tuition fee loan

P1para.Text: A tuition fee loan is a loan made available by the Welsh Ministers to an eligible student for the payment of tuition fees in respect of an academic year.

P1group.Title: Qualifying conditions for tuition fee loan

P1para.Text: An eligible student qualifies for a tuition fee loan in respect of an academic year of the present course unless one of the following exceptions applies

P2para.Text: Where the present course is not an accelerated graduate entry course, the academic year is an Erasmus year of a course provided by an institution in Northern Ireland.

Text.Substitution: Where the present course is not an accelerated graduate entry course, the academic year is a year in respect of which a student is eligible to apply for a healthcare bursary calculated by reference to the students income (whether or not the calculation results in a nil amount).

P2para.Text: Where the present course is a part-time course or an accelerated graduate entry course, the academic year is an Erasmus year of the course provided by an institution anywhere in the United Kingdom.

Text.Substitution: The present course is a distance learning course and the student (S) is not in Wales on the first day of the first academic year of the course.
But this exception does not apply where
S is not in Wales on the first day of the first academic year of the course because S, or a close relative of S, is serving as a member of the armed forces outside Wales, or
S is unable to be in Wales on the first day of the first academic year of the course for a reason related to coronavirus.

P1group.Title: Amount of tuition fee loan

P2para.Text: An amount of tuition fee loan in respect of an academic year may not exceed the lower of

P3para.Text: the tuition fees payable by the eligible student in respect of that year, or
the maximum loan amount.

P2para.Text: The maximum loan amount is calculated in accordance with Table 2 where

P3para.Text: Column 1 specifies the academic year in relation to which the maximum loan amounts in Column 5 are payable;
Column 2 specifies the category of student to whom the maximum loan amounts in Column 5 apply (see paragraph (3));
Column 3 specifies the type of course provider, where

P4para.Text: ordinary provider means a provider falling within Condition 4 of Regulation 6(1) or a provider specified in column 2 of Table 14A in Schedule 1A in so far as they provide the course described in the corresponding entry in column 3;
private institution means an institution, which is not a recognised educational institution, providing a course specified as a designated course by the Welsh Ministers under regulation 8;

P3para.Text: Column 4 specifies the location of the institution providing the course;
Column 5 specifies the maximum loan amount applicable in respect of the corresponding entries in Columns 1, 2, 3 and 4.

P2para.Text: The categories of students set out in Column 2 are
An eligible student undertaking a designated course who does not fall within Category 2, 3, 4 , 5 or 6.
An eligible student undertaking the final academic year of a full-time course which ordinarily requires attendance of less than 15 weeks in order to be completed.
An eligible student undertaking an academic year of a sandwich course provided by an institution in the United Kingdom where

P3para.Text: the periods of full-time study undertaken at the institution during that academic year are in aggregate less than 10 weeks, or

the periods spent undertaking the course during that academic year and any previous academic years (which are not periods of full-time study at the institution), disregarding intervening vacations, are in aggregate more than 30 weeks.

P2para.Text: An eligible student undertaking an academic year of a course provided by an institution in the United Kingdom in conjunction with an institution which is outside the United Kingdom where

P3para.Text: the periods of full-time study undertaken at the institution in the United Kingdom during that academic year are in aggregate less than 10 weeks, or

the periods spent undertaking the course during that academic year and any previous academic years (which are not periods of full-time study at the institution in the United Kingdom), disregarding intervening vacations, are in aggregate more than 30 weeks.

P2para.Text: An eligible student undertaking an accelerated graduate entry course.

Title.Addition: Category 6

Text.Addition: An eligible student undertaking an Erasmus year of a full-time course provided by an institution in England, Scotland or Wales.

xhtml:tr.xhtml:td: Beginning on or after 1 September 2018 but before 1 September 2024

Para.Text: 9,000 for a full-time course
2,625 for a part-time course
9250 for a full-time course
6,935 for a part-time course
6,165 for a full-time course
2,625 for a part-time course
6,165 for a full-time course
4,625 for a part-time course

Text.Addition: 9,250 for a full-time course
2,625 for a part-time course
9,250 for a full-time course
6,935 for a part-time course
6,165 for a full-time course
2,625 for a part-time course
6,165 for a full-time course
4,625 for a part-time course
9,535 for a full-time course
2,625 for a part-time course
9,535 for a full-time course
7,145 for a part-time course
6,355 for a full-time course
2,625 for a part-time course
6,355 for a full-time course
4,765 for a part-time course

P1group.Title: Applying for a fee loan for less than the maximum amount

P1para.Text: An eligible student may apply under regulation 32 to borrow part of the tuition fee loan available in respect of an academic year.

P1group.Title: Further application for tuition fee loan up to maximum amount

P1para.Text: Where

P3para.Text: an eligible student applies for part of the tuition fee loan under regulation 41, or
an additional amount of tuition fee loan is made available to an eligible student following a transfer and reassessment made under Section 5 of Chapter 2 of Part 4,

P1para.Text: the student may make a further application under regulation 32 for the remaining balance of the tuition fee loan available in respect of that academic year.

P1group.Title: Base grant and maintenance grant

P1para.Text: A base grant and maintenance grant are grants made available by the Welsh Ministers to an eligible student in respect of the student's living and study costs.

P1group.Title: Qualifying conditions for base grant and maintenance grant

P2para.Text: An eligible student qualifies for a base grant and a maintenance grant in respect of an academic year of the present course unless the eligible student falls within one of the following exceptions
Exception 1 The eligible student is a prisoner, unless

P3para.Text: the present course is a part-time course, and
the eligible student enters or is released from prison in the academic year in question.

Text.Substitution: The only paragraph or paragraphs of Schedule 2 into which the eligible student falls is one or more of

The academic year is a year in respect of which the student is eligible to apply for a healthcare bursary calculated by reference to the students income (whether or not the calculation results in a nil amount).

P2para.Text: Exception 4 The present course is an accelerated graduate entry course.

Text.Substitution: The present course is a distance learning course and the student (S) is not in Wales on the first day of the first academic year of the course.
But this exception does not apply where
S is not in Wales on the first day of the first academic year of the course because S, or a close relative of S, is serving as a member of the armed forces outside Wales, or
S is unable to be in Wales on the first day of the first academic year of the course for a reason related to coronavirus.

P2para.Text: Exception 6 The eligible student is undertaking an academic year of a sandwich course during which the periods of full-time study are in aggregate less than 10 weeks (unless it is a year to which paragraph (2) applies).
This paragraph applies to an academic year of a sandwich course if, as part of the course, the eligible student undertakes

P3para.Text: a period of work experience with a body in the United Kingdom specified in paragraph (3), or
unpaid research

P4para.Text: in an institution in the United Kingdom, or
outside the United Kingdom if the eligible student is attending an institution outside the United Kingdom as part of the course.

P2para.Text: The bodies referred to in paragraph (2)(a) are

P3para.Text: a hospital;
a public health service laboratory;
a local authority or voluntary organisation exercising a function or carrying out activities relating to the care of children and young persons, health or welfare;
a body providing prison or probation services in the United Kingdom;
a health body listed in paragraph (4).

P2para.Text: The health bodies are

P3para.Text: a Special Health Authority established under section 28 of the National Health Service Act 2006 or section 22 of the National Health Service (Wales) Act 2006 ;
an NHS trust established under section 25 of the National Health Service Act 2006 or section 18 of the National Health Service (Wales) Act 2006;
an NHS foundation trust;
a Local Health Board established under section 11 of the National Health Service (Wales) Act 2006;
a Health Board or Special Health Board constituted under section 2 of the National Health Service (Scotland) Act 1978 ;
the Regional Health and Social Care Board established under section 7 of the Health and Social Care (Reform) Act (Northern Ireland) 2009 ;
the Regional Agency for Public Health and Social Well-being established under section 12 of that Act;
a health and social care trust (formerly called a health and social services trust) established under the Health and Personal Social Services (Northern Ireland) Order 1991 ;

a special health and social care agency (formerly called a special health and social services agency) established under the Health and Personal Social Services (Special Agencies) (Northern Ireland) Order 1990 ;
NHS England, the body corporate established under section 1H of the National Health Service Act 2006 or an integrated care board established under Chapter A3 of Part 2 of that Act;
the National Institute for Health and Care Excellence established under section 232 of the Health and Social Care Act 2012 ;

P1group.Title: Amount of base grant

P1para.Text: In Table 3, Column 2 sets out the amount of base grant available for the academic year set out in the corresponding entry in Column 1.

Para.Text: 1,000 for a full-time course
1,000 multiplied by the intensity of study for a part-time course

P1group.Title: Amount of maintenance grant: full-time students

P2para.Text: Table 4 sets out the maximum amounts of maintenance grant available to an eligible student undertaking a full-time course (a full-time student) where

P3para.Text: Column 1 specifies the academic year in relation to which the amounts of maintenance grant specified in Column 3 are payable;
Column 2 specifies the location in which the student is living (see paragraph 3 of Schedule 1);
Column 3 specifies the maximum amount of grant available in respect of the corresponding entries in Columns 1 and 2.

P2para.Text: Where

P3para.Text: the student's household income does not exceed 18,370, or
the student is a care leaver,

P2para.Text: the amount of maintenance grant payable is the maximum amount of grant available in respect of the student's location.

Where the student's household income exceeds 18,370 but is less than 59,200, the amount of maintenance grant payable to the student is the maximum amount of maintenance grant available reduced by 1 for every

P3para.Text: 6.937 of household income exceeding 18,370 where the student is living at home;
4.475 of household income exceeding 18,370 where the student is living away from home, studying in London;
