5.750 of household income exceeding 18,370 where the student is living away from home, studying elsewhere.

P2para.Text: Where the full-time student's household income is 59,200 or more, the amount of maintenance grant payable is 0.

th.leg:Emphasis: Column 3 Maximum amount of maintenance grant available to full-time studen

tr.td: Beginning on or after 1 September 2018
Living at home
Living away from home, studying in London
Living away from home, studying elsewhere

P1group.Title: Amount of maintenance grant: part-time students

P2para.Text: Table 5 sets out the maximum amounts of maintenance grant available to an eligible student undertaking a part-time course (a part-time student) where

P3para.Text: Column 1 specifies the academic year in relation to which the amounts of maintenance grant specified in Column 2 are payable;
Column 2 specifies the maximum amount of grant available in respect of the corresponding academic year in Column 1.

P2para.Text: If

P3para.Text: a part-time student's household income does not exceed 25,000, or
the student is a care leaver,

P2para.Text: the amount of maintenance grant payable to the student is the maximum amount available multiplied by the intensity of study of the present course.

Where the part-time student's household income exceeds 25,000 but is less than 59,200, the amount of maintenance grant payable is calculated as follows Step 1 Reduce the maximum amount of maintenance grant available by 1 for every 6.84 of household income exceeding 25,000. Step 2 Multiply the result of Step 1 by the intensity of study of the present course. The result is the amount of maintenance grant payable.
Where the part-time student's household income is 59,200 or more, the amount of maintenance grant payable is 0.

th.leg:Emphasis: Maximum amount of maintenance grant available to part-time student

tr.td: Beginning on or after 1 September 2018

P1group.Title: Household income

P1para.Text: See Part 2 of Schedule 3 for provision about calculating an eligible student's household income.

P1group.Title: Meaning of care leaver

P1para.Text: An eligible student is a care leaver if the student

P3para.Text: is under the age of 25 on the first day of the first academic year of the present course,
is, or has been, a category of young person defined in, or by virtue of, section 104 of the Social Services and Well-being (Wales) Act 2014 , and
between the student's 14th birthday and the first day of the first academic year of the course, the student

P4para.Text: was looked after, fostered or accommodated (within the meaning of sections 74 and 104 of the Social Services and Well-being (Wales) Act 2014) for an aggregate period of 13 weeks or more, or
was a person with respect to whom a special guardianship order (within the meaning given by section 14A of the Children Act 1989) was in force for a period of 13 weeks or more.

P1group.Title: Special support payment

P2para.Text: Where an eligible student who qualifies for a base grant or, as the case may be, a maintenance grant, meets one of the qualifying conditions in regulation 51

P3para.Text: all of the base grant payable to the eligible student, and
an amount of maintenance grant payable to the student up to the maximum specified in regulation 52,

P2para.Text: is to be treated as a special support payment.
A special support payment is a payment which is intended to meet

P3para.Text: the cost of books and equipment;
travel expenses;
childcare costs,

P2para.Text: in connection with an eligible student undertaking a designated course.

P1group.Title: Special support payment: qualifying conditions

P1para.Text: An eligible student qualifies for a special support payment in respect of an academic year of the present course if the eligible student satisfies one of the following conditions Condition A The eligible student, for the purposes of assessing entitlement to income support, falls within a prescribed category of person for the purposes of section 124(1)(e) of the Social Security Contributions and Benefits Act 1992. Condition B The eligible student, for the purposes of assessing entitlement to housing benefit, is treated as being liable to make payments in respect of a dwelling prescribed by regulations made under section 130(2) of that Act . Condition C The eligible student, for the purposes of assessing entitlement to universal credit, is liable or is treated as being liable under regulation 25(3) of the Universal Credit Regulations 2013 to make payments in respect of accommodation the student occupies as his or her home.

P1group.Title: Maximum amount of maintenance grant treated as special support payment

P1para.Text: In Table 6, Column 2 sets out the maximum amount of maintenance grant payable as special support payment in respect of the academic year set out in the corresponding entry in Column 1.

xhtml:th.Emphasis: Maximum amount of maintenance grant payable as part of a special support payment

Para.Text: 4,161 for a full-time course
5,000 multiplied by the intensity of study for a part-time course

P1group.Title: Maintenance loan

P1para.Text: A maintenance loan is a loan made available by the Welsh Ministers to an eligible student in respect of living costs for an academic year.

P1group.Title: Qualifying conditions for a maintenance loan

P1para.Text: An eligible student qualifies for a maintenance loan in respect of an academic year of the present course unless one of the following exceptions applies
Exception 1 The eligible student is a prisoner, unless

P3para.Text: the present course is a part-time course, and
the eligible student enters or is released from prison in the academic year in question.

Text.Substitution: The only paragraph or paragraphs of Schedule 2 into which the eligible student falls is one or more of

P1para.Text: Exception 3 The eligible student is aged 60 or over on the first day of the first academic year of the present course.

Text.Substitution: The present course is a distance learning course and the student (S) is not in Wales on the first day of the first academic year of the course.
But this exception does not apply where
S is not in Wales on the first day of the first academic year of the course because S, or a close relative of S, is serving as a member of the armed forces outside Wales, or
S is unable to be in Wales on the first day of the first academic year of the course for a reason related to coronavirus.

P1group.Title: Amount of maintenance loan: full-time students

P2para.Text: Where an eligible student's present course is a full-time course (a full-time student), the amount of maintenance loan payable to the student is calculated as follows Maximum amount of maintenance loan available to the student in respect of an academic year. Minus Amount of maintenance grant payable to the student under regulation 46.
Table 7 sets out the maximum amounts of maintenance loan available in respect of a full-time student where

P3para.Text: Column 1 specifies the academic year in relation to which the amounts of maintenance loan specified in Column 4 apply;
Column 2 specifies the category of student to whom the maximum amounts in Column 4 apply;
Column 3 specifies the location in which the student is living (see paragraph 3 of Schedule 1);
Column 4 specifies the maximum amount of loan available in respect of the corresponding entries in Columns 1, 2 and 3.

P2para.Text: For the purposes of this regulation the categories of student are

Text.Substitution: An eligible student undertaking an academic year of a designated course, who is not a Category 2 student.

An eligible student undertaking an academic year of a sandwich course during which the periods of full-time study undertaken by the student are in aggregate less than 10 weeks (unless it is a year to which regulation 44(2) applies).

P2para.Text: This regulation is subject to regulation 56.

Emphasis.Substitution: Maximum amount of maintenance loan available to full-time student

P1group.Title: Increased maintenance loan for full-time students in extended years

P2para.Text: Paragraph (2) applies where

P3para.Text: the present course is a full-time course, and
an eligible student is required to undertake the course for a period exceeding 30 weeks and 3 days in an academic year.

P2para.Text: Where this paragraph applies, the amount of loan payable to the student calculated under regulation 55 or, as the case may be, 56 is increased by the weekly amount specified in Column 3 of Table 9 for each week (or part of a week) that the student is required to undertake the course beyond the period of 30 weeks and 3 days.
Paragraph (4) applies where

P3para.Text: the present course is a full-time course, and
an eligible student undertakes the course for a period of 45 weeks or more in any continuous period of 52 weeks.

P2para.Text: Where this paragraph applies, the amount of loan payable to the student calculated under regulation 55 or, as the case may be, 56 is increased by the weekly amount specified in Column 3 of Table 9 for each whole week in the 52 week period during which the student did not undertake the course.
The increase in the amount of maintenance loan payable referred to in paragraph (4) applies in relation to the academic year into which the most weeks of the 52 week period fall.
The maximum amount of maintenance loan payable to an eligible student may be increased under both paragraphs (2) and (4) in relation to the same academic year.
In Table 9

P3para.Text: Column 1 specifies the academic year in relation to which the maintenance loan is payable;
Column 2 specifies the location in which the student is living (see paragraph 3 of Schedule 1);
Column 3 specifies the weekly amount by which the amount of loan payable is to increase in respect of the corresponding entries in Columns 1 and 2.

Emphasis.Substitution: Weekly amount of increase to maintenance loan payable

P1group.Title: Amount of maintenance loan: part-time students

P2para.Text: Where an eligible student's present course is a part-time course (a part-time student), the amount of maintenance loan payable to the student is calculated as follows Maximum amount of maintenance loan available to the student (see Table 10). Minus Amount of maintenance grant payable to the student under regulation 47.
In Table 10, Column 1 specifies the academic year in relation to which the maximum amount of maintenance loan in Column 2 is available.

The amount of maintenance loan is calculated by applying the following steps

Text.Addition: Identify the amount of base grant and maintenance grant payable to the student which is to be treated as a special support payment under regulation 50.

The result is the amount of maintenance loan payable to the student.
In this regulation, living support is the collective term for special support payment, maintenance grant and maintenance loan.

The result is the amount of maintenance loan payable to the student.
In this regulation, living support is the collective term for special support payment, maintenance grant and maintenance loan.

P1group.Title: Applying for maintenance loan for less than the maximum amount

P1para.Text: An eligible student may apply under regulation 32 to borrow part of the amount of maintenance loan payable to the eligible student in respect of an academic year.

P1group.Title: Further application for maintenance loan up to maximum amount

P1para.Text: Where

P3para.Text: an eligible student applies for part of the maintenance loan under regulation 59, or
an additional amount of maintenance loan is made available to an eligible student following a transfer and reassessment made under Section 5 of Chapter 2 of Part 4,

P1para.Text: the student may make a further application under regulation 32 for the remaining balance of the maintenance loan payable in respect of that academic year.

P1group.Title: Disabled student's grant

P2para.Text: A disabled student's grant is a grant made available by the Welsh Ministers to an eligible student with a disability to assist with additional expenditure in respect of living costs which the student is obliged to incur in connection with the present course by reason of the student's disability.
In these Regulations, disability is to be construed in accordance with section 6 of the Equality Act 2010.

P1group.Title: Qualifying conditions for disabled student's grant

P2para.Text: An eligible student qualifies for a disabled student's grant in respect of an academic year of the present course if

P3para.Text: the student has a disability, and
the student does not fall within any of the exceptions in paragraph (2).

P2para.Text: The exceptions are
Exception 1 The eligible student is a prisoner, unless

P3para.Text: the present course is a part-time course, and
the eligible student enters or is released from prison in the academic year in question.

Text.Substitution: The only paragraph or paragraphs of Schedule 2 into which the eligible student falls is one or more of

The present course is a full-time course and the academic year is a year in respect of which the student is eligible to apply for a healthcare bursary calculated by reference to the students income (whether or not the calculation results in a nil amount).

P2para.Text: The eligible student is undertaking an academic year of an accelerated graduate entry course, other than the first year of the course.

Text.Substitution: The present course is a distance learning course and the student (S) is not in Wales on the first day of the first academic year of the course.
But this exception does not apply where
S is not in Wales on the first day of the first academic year of the course because S, or a close relative of S, is serving as a member of the armed forces outside Wales, or
S is unable to be in Wales on the first day of the first academic year of the course for a reason related to coronavirus.

P2para.Text: The eligible student is undertaking an academic year of a sandwich course during which the periods of full-time study are in aggregate less than 10 weeks (unless it is a year to which regulation 44(2) applies).

Text.Addition: But this exception does not apply in respect of a disabled students grant so far as it relates to the provision of technical support, repairs or replacement in respect of equipment belonging to the student, where
that equipment was
funded wholly or partly by a disabled students grant, or
approved by the Welsh Ministers for use by the student for the purposes of a disabled students grant, and
the disabled students grant referred to in paragraph (a) was approved in respect of
a previous academic year of the present course, or
an academic year of a previous course, where the student has received confirmation from the Welsh Ministers that that grant will be transferred to the present course.

P1group.Title: Amount of disabled student's grant

P2para.Text: The amount of disabled student's grant for which a student qualifies in respect of an academic year is the amount

P3para.Text: which the Welsh Ministers think appropriate, but
which does not exceed the aggregate amount of the limits applicable in respect of the Cases listed in paragraph (2).

Text.Substitution: The Cases and limits are

Expenditure required on a non-medical personal helper, major items of specialist equipment and any other expenditure the eligible student incurs in connection with the course by reason of the students disability (apart from the expenditure specified in Case 2).
Limit of
in respect of an academic year of a course.
Additional expenditure incurred
within the United Kingdom for the purpose of attending an institution, and

within or outside the United Kingdom for the purpose of attending, as part of the present course, any period of study at an overseas institution (including the University of London Institute in Paris).
Limited to the actual expenditure incurred for this purpose.

P1group.Title: Grant for travel

P1para.Text: A grant for travel is a grant made available by the Welsh Ministers to an eligible student in the circumstances set out in regulation 65(1) or 66(1).

P1group.Title: Grant for travel for medical students

P2para.Text: A grant for travel is available to an eligible student if the following conditions are satisfied
The present course is a full-time course in

P3para.Text: medicine, or
dentistry,

P2para.Text: a necessary part of which is a period of study by way of clinical training.
In the academic year in question, the eligible student is obliged to incur expenditure for the purpose of attending

P3para.Text: a hospital, or
other premises,

P2para.Text: in the United Kingdom (not comprised in the institution providing the present course) so as to undertake clinical training as part of the course.

Text.Substitution: The academic year is not a year in respect of which the student is eligible to apply for a healthcare bursary calculated by reference to the students income (whether or not the calculation results in a nil amount).

P2para.Text: But a grant for travel is not available where the eligible student is a Category 6 eligible student by virtue only of paragraph 6(1) of Schedule 2 and does not fall within any of the other categories of eligible student specified in that Schedule.
The amount of grant for travel payable under this regulation in respect of an academic year is the amount determined by the Welsh Ministers as follows

Determine the amount of reasonable expenditure incurred by the eligible student in the academic year in question for the purpose mentioned in Condition 2 of paragraph (1) (including expenditure incurred for that purpose before or after attending the hospital or other premises).

If the eligible student's household income (see Schedule 3) is less than 59,200 in respect of that year or the eligible student is a care leaver within the meaning given by regulation 49, deduct 303 from the amount arrived at in Step 1.
If the eligible student's household income is 59,200 or more in respect of that year, deduct 1,000 from the amount arrived at in Step 1. The result is the amount of grant for travel payable.
Expenditure incurred for the purpose of residential study away from the institution providing the present course is not expenditure incurred for the purpose mentioned in Condition 2 of paragraph (1).

P1group.Title: Grant for travel for study or work overseas

P2para.Text: A grant for travel is available to an eligible student if the following conditions are satisfied
Condition 1 The present course is a full-time course.
Condition 2 For at least of half of any quarter of the academic year in question, the eligible student attends, as part of the course

P3para.Text: an overseas institution (including the University of London Institute in Paris), or
an overseas work placement in an Erasmus year,

P2para.Text: (such attendance being referred to in this regulation as the placement and such a quarter being referred to as a qualifying quarter).
Condition 3 The student incurs

P3para.Text: travel costs, or
any expenditure mentioned in paragraph (3),

P2para.Text: for the purpose of the placement.
The amount of grant for travel payable under this regulation in respect of an academic year is the amount determined by the Welsh Ministers in accordance with the following formula

Para.Text: Where
X is the aggregate of the reasonable travel costs that the eligible student is obliged to incur in each qualifying quarter for the purposes of the placement;
Y is

303 if the eligible student's household income (see Schedule 3) is less than 59,200 in respect of the academic year in question or the eligible student is a care leaver within the meaning given by regulation 49, or
1,000 if the eligible student's household income is 59,200 or more in respect of that year;
Z is the aggregate of any expenditure incurred in each qualifying quarter specified in paragraph (3).

P2para.Text: The expenditure mentioned in paragraphs (1) and (2) is

P3para.Text: expenditure that the eligible student reasonably incurs in insuring against liability for the cost of medical treatment provided outside the United Kingdom for any illness or personal injury contracted or suffered during the placement;
the cost of any visa the student is obliged to obtain in order to attend the placement;
medical costs that the student reasonably incurs in order to fulfil a mandatory condition of entry into the territory, country or state in which the placement is situated.

P1group.Title: Grant for travel not payable for expenditure covered by disabled student's grant

P1para.Text: Where a disabled student's grant is payable to assist an eligible student with expenditure that the student is obliged to incur in connection with the present course by reason of the student's disability, no grant for travel is payable under regulation 65 or 66 in respect of the same expenditure.

P1group.Title: Grants for dependants

P2para.Text: The following are grants made available by the Welsh Ministers to an eligible student in respect of costs associated with certain dependants of the student for an academic year

P3para.Text: an adult dependants grant (see Chapter 2);
a parents' learning grant (see Chapter 3);
a childcare grant (see Chapter 4).

P2para.Text: In these Regulations, those grants are collectively referred to as grants for dependants (GfDs).

P1group.Title: Qualifying conditions for grants for dependants

P2para.Text: An eligible student qualifies for any particular GfD in respect of an academic year of the present course if the student

P3para.Text: satisfies the qualifying conditions for that grant,
does not fall within any of the exceptions in paragraph (2), and
if the student's present course is a part-time course, the intensity of study of the academic year is at least 25%.

P2para.Text: The exceptions are Exception 1 The eligible student is a prisoner, unless

P3para.Text: the present course is a part-time course, and
the student enters or is released from prison in the academic year in question.

Text.Substitution: The only paragraph or paragraphs of Schedule 2 into which the eligible student falls is one or more of

The academic year is a year in respect of which the student is eligible to apply for a healthcare bursary calculated by reference to the students income (whether or not the calculation results in a nil amount).

P2para.Text: Exception 4 The eligible student is undertaking an academic year of an accelerated graduate entry course, other than the first year of the course. ... Exception 6 The eligible student is undertaking an academic year of a sandwich course during which the periods of full-time study are in aggregate less than 10 weeks (unless it is a year to which Regulation 44(2) applies). Exception 7 The person in respect of whom the eligible student is applying

P3para.Text: is an eligible student, and
is in receipt of a statutory award.

Title.Addition: Exception 8

Text.Addition: The present course is a distance learning course and the student (
) is not in Wales on the first day of the first academic year of the course.
But this exception does not apply where
S is not in Wales on the first day of the first academic year of the course because S, or a close relative of S, is serving as a member of the armed forces outside Wales, or
S is unable to be in Wales on the first day of the first academic year of the course for a reason related to coronavirus.

P1group.Title: Interpretation of this Part

P2para.Text: In this Part

Para.Text: adult dependant (oedolyn dibynnol) means an adult person
who is wholly or mainly financially dependent on the eligible student, or
who is wholly or mainly financially dependent on both the eligible student and the eligible student's partner together,
but not the eligible student's child, the eligible student's partner (including a partner from whom the eligible student is separated) or the eligible student's former partner;
current academic year (blwyddyn academiaddgyfredol) means the academic year of the present course in respect of which the eligible student is applying for a GfD;
dependent child (plentyn dibynnol) means a child
who is wholly or mainly financially dependent on the eligible student, or
who is wholly or mainly financially dependent on both the eligible student and the eligible student's partner together,
including a child of the eligible student's partner and a child for whom the eligible student has parental responsibility;
lone parent (rhiant unigol) means a person who
is a parent of a dependent child, and
does not have a partner.

P2para.Text: In this Part, any reference to a person's (A's) partner means

P3para.Text: A's spouse or civil partner, or
a person ordinarily living with A as if the person were A's spouse or civil partner.

P2para.Text: Any reference in this Part to a person's or persons' income is a reference to that income as calculated in accordance with the appropriate provisions of Schedule 3.

P1group.Title: Adult dependants grant

P2para.Text: An eligible student qualifies for an adult dependants grant in respect of only one of the following persons

P3para.Text: the student's partner;
an adult dependant of the student.

P2para.Text: But an eligible student does not qualify for an adult dependants grant if one of the following exceptions applies Exception 1 Where the eligible student is applying in respect of an adult dependant (A)

P3para.Text: A's net income for the current academic year exceeds 3,923, or
A is

P4para.Text: the spouse or civil partner of the eligible student's partner (including a spouse or civil partner from whom the student's partner is separated), or
the former partner of the eligible student's partner.

P2para.Text: Exception 2 Where the eligible student is applying in respect of the student's partner (P)

P3para.Text: the eligible student is, in the opinion of the Welsh Ministers, separated from P, or
P is ordinarily living outside the United Kingdom and is not maintained by the eligible student.

P1group.Title: Maximum amount of adult dependants grant

P2para.Text: In Table 11, Column 2 sets out the maximum amount of adult dependants grant payable in respect of an academic year in the corresponding entry in Column 1.

But where the person in respect of whom the eligible student is applying is ordinarily resident outside the United Kingdom, the amount of adult dependants grant payable is an amount, not exceeding the maximum amount, which the Welsh Ministers consider reasonable in the circumstances.

Emphasis.Substitution: Maximum amount of adult dependants grant

xhtml:td.Substitution: Beginning on or after 1 September 2018 but before 1 September 2020
Beginning on or after 1 September 2020 but before 1 September 2021

P1group.Title: Parents' learning grant

P1para.Text: An eligible student qualifies for a parents' learning grant if the eligible student has one or more dependent children.

P1group.Title: Maximum amount of parents' learning grant

P1para.Text: In Table 12, Column 2 sets out the maximum amount of parents' learning grant payable in respect of an academic year in the corresponding entry in Column1.

Emphasis.Substitution: Maximum amount of parents' learning grant

xhtml:td.Substitution: Beginning on or after 1 September 2018 but before 1 September 2020
Beginning on or after 1 September 2020 but before 1 September 2021

P1group.Title: Childcare grant

P2para.Text: An eligible student qualifies for a childcare grant in respect of prescribed childcare charges for a dependent child incurred during the current academic year if one of the following conditions are satisfied Condition 1 The dependent child is under the age of 15 immediately before the beginning of the academic year. Condition 2 The dependent child has special educational needs within the meaning of section 312 of the Education Act 1996 and is under the age of 17 immediately before the beginning of the first day of the academic year.

But the eligible student does not qualify for a childcare grant in any of the following cases Case 1 The eligible student or the eligible student's partner has elected to receive the childcare element of the working tax credit under Part 1 of the Tax Credits Act 2002 . Case 2 The eligible student or the eligible student's partner is entitled to an award of universal credit which includes an amount in respect of childcare costs under regulation 31 of the Universal Credit Regulations 2013 (child care costs element) . Case 3 The eligible student's partner has elected to receive financial support for childcare under a healthcare bursary. Case 4 The prescribed childcare charges are for a period in respect of which the eligible student or the eligible student's partner has made a valid declaration of eligibility within the meaning given by section 4 of the Childcare Payments Act 2014 . Case 5 The prescribed childcare charges are paid or to be paid by the eligible student to the student's partner. Case 6 The prescribed childcare charges are in respect of any period between the end of the course and the end of the academic year in which the course ends.
In this regulation and regulation 76

Para.Text: dependent child (plentyn dibynnol) includes a dependent child born after the beginning of the academic year;
prescribed childcare charges (ffioedd gofal plant rhagnodedig) means childcare charges of a description prescribed for the purposes of section 12 of the Tax Credits Act 2002 .

P1group.Title: Maximum amount of childcare grant

P2para.Text: The amount of childcare grant payable is 85% of the eligible student's weekly prescribed childcare charges, up to the maximum weekly amount

P3para.Text: specified in Table 13, or
where paragraph (4) applies, specified in that paragraph.

P2para.Text: In Table 13

P3para.Text: Column 1 specifies the academic year in relation to which the maximum weekly amount of childcare grant in Column 3 is payable;
Column 2 specifies the number of dependent children to which the amounts specified in Column 3 relate;

Column 3 specifies the maximum weekly amount of childcare grant payable in respect of the corresponding entries in Columns 1 and 2, where the application for a childcare grant identifies a childcare provider.

xhtml:td.Substitution: Beginning on or after 1 September 2018 but before 1 September 2020
Beginning on or after 1 September 2020 but before 1 September 2021

P2para.Text: Where the eligible student has more than one dependent child, the amount specified in the appropriate entry in Column 3 is the maximum weekly amount payable, irrespective of the number of children receiving childcare.
Where the eligible student's application for childcare grant does not identify the childcare provider, the Welsh Ministers may limit

P3para.Text: the amount of childcare grant paid to the student to 85% of the prescribed childcare charges up to a maximum weekly amount of 147;
the payment of the childcare grant to one quarter of the academic year.

P2para.Text: For the purposes of calculating an amount of childcare grant, a week runs from Monday to Sunday.

Where prescribed childcare charges are incurred in respect of a week that falls partly within and partly outside the academic year in respect of which childcare grant is payable, the maximum weekly amount is calculated by applying the following formula

Para.Text: Where
A is the applicable maximum weekly amount, and
B is the number of days of the week falling within the academic year.

Chapter.Title: AMOUNT OF GRANT FOR DEPENDANTS PAYABLE

P1group.Title: Grants for dependants: calculating the amount payable

P2para.Text: The amount of GfD payable to an eligible student in respect of an academic year is calculated by applying the following steps Step 1 Aggregate

P3para.Text: the eligible student's household income calculated under Part 2 of Schedule 3,

if not already taken into account as part of the eligible student's household income, the residual income of the eligible student's adult dependant for the applicable financial year calculated under Chapter 2 of Part 4 of Schedule 3, and
the net income of the eligible student's dependent children for the applicable financial year calculated under Part 5 of Schedule 3.

P2para.Text: Step 2 Deduct the following amounts from the aggregated total calculated under Step 1

P3para.Text: 6,434, where the eligible student has no dependent children;
8,852, where the eligible student is not a lone parent and has one dependent child;
10,062, where the eligible student

P4para.Text: is not a lone parent and has more than one dependent child, or
is a lone parent and has one dependent child;

P3para.Text: 11,279, where the eligible student is a lone parent and has more than one dependent child.

P2para.Text: The result is the net total. Step 3 Add up the maximum amounts of each GfD for which the eligible student qualifies. The result is the aggregated maximums. Step 4

P3para.Text: If the net total under Step 2 is nil or a negative amount, the amount payable is

P4para.Text: where the present course is a full-time course, the aggregated maximums arrived at under Step 3;
where the present course is a part-time course, the aggregated maximums arrived at under Step 3 reduced in accordance with paragraph (2).

P3para.Text: If the net total under Step 2 is equal to or exceeds the aggregated maximums arrived at under Step 3, the amount payable is nil.

If the net total under Step 2 is a positive amount which is less than the aggregated maximums arrived at under Step 3, deduct the net total from the aggregated maximums so as to reduce the amount of GfDs payable in the following order until the net total is extinguished

P4para.Text: first deduct the maximum amount of adult dependants grant for which the eligible student qualifies;
then deduct the maximum amount of childcare grant for which the student qualifies;
finally deduct the maximum amount of parents' learning grant for which the student qualifies.

P3para.Text: Where sub-paragraph (c) of this Step applies, the amount remaining after that reduction is

P4para.Text: the amount payable where the present course is a full-time course;
the amount to be reduced in accordance with paragraph (2) where the present course is a part-time course.

Text.Substitution: If the eligible students present course is a part-time course, the amount of GfD payable is the amount referred to in paragraph (a)(ii) or (d)(ii) of Step 4 of paragraph (1) multiplied by
25%, where the intensity of study for the current academic year is at least 25% but less than 30%;
30%, where the intensity of study for the current academic year is at least 30% but less than 40%;
40%, where the intensity of study for the current academic year is at least 40% but less than 50%;
50%, where the intensity of study for the current academic year is at least 50% but less than 60%;
60%, where the intensity of study for the current academic year is at least 60% but less than 75%;
75%, where the intensity of study for the current academic year is 75% or more.

P2para.Text: Where the amount of GfD payable as a result of Step 4 of paragraph (1) or, as the case may be, paragraph (2), is an amount of parents' learning grant which is more than 0.01 but less than 50, the amount payable is 50.
This regulation is subject to regulations 78 and 79.

P1group.Title: Amount of adult dependants grant and childcare grant: eligible student's partner is an eligible student

P1para.Text: Where, as a result of Step 4 of paragraph (1) of regulation 77 or, as the case may be, paragraph (2) of that regulation, an amount of adult dependants grant and childcare grant is payable to an eligible student, that amount is reduced by one half where

P3para.Text: the eligible student's partner

P4para.Text: is an eligible student, or
is in receipt of a statutory award, and

P3para.Text: the amount of support payable to the partner

P4para.Text: by virtue of the partner being an eligible student, or
under the statutory award

P3para.Text: takes account of the partner's dependants.

P1group.Title: Changes in circumstances

P2para.Text: This regulation applies where, in the course of the academic year, any of the following occurs

P3para.Text: there is a change in the number of the eligible student's dependants;
the student becomes or ceases to be a lone parent;
the student becomes an eligible student as a result of an event referred to in regulation 81(3).

P2para.Text: For the purposes of determining whether an adult dependants grant or parents' learning grant is payable and the amount payable, the Welsh Ministers must determine the following in relation to each relevant quarter

P3para.Text: how many dependants the eligible student is to be treated as having;
whether the student is to be treated as a lone parent.

P2para.Text: The total amount of GfD payable for the academic year is

P3para.Text: the aggregate of the amounts of adult dependants grant and parents' learning grant calculated in respect of each relevant quarter under this regulation, plus
the amount of any childcare grant payable for the academic year.

P2para.Text: The amount of adult dependants grant and parents' learning grant payable in respect of a relevant quarter is one third of the amount of that grant which would be payable for the academic year as determined under regulation 77 if the student's circumstances in the relevant quarter had been the same throughout the whole of the academic year.
In this regulation a relevant quarter means

P3para.Text: in the case of an eligible student referred to in paragraph (1)(c), a quarter which begins immediately after the relevant event occurs other than a quarter during which the longest of any vacation occurs;
otherwise, a quarter other than the quarter during which the longest of any vacation occurs.

Part.Title: QUALIFYING FOR SUPPORT DURING THE ACADEMIC YEAR

P1group.Title: Qualifying for a tuition fee loan during the academic year

P2para.Text: Where one of the events listed in paragraph (2) occurs within 3 months of the first day of the academic year, the student may qualify for a tuition fee loan in respect of that academic year.
The events are

P3para.Text: the present course becomes a designated course;
the student becomes an eligible student on the grounds that

Text.Substitution: the student or the students spouse, civil partner or parent is recognised as a refugee, becomes a person granted stateless leave, becomes a person with leave to enter or remain or becomes a person granted humanitarian protection under paragraph 339C of the immigration rules;

Text.Addition: the student or the students parent becomes a person with section 67 leave to remain

Addition.Substitution: granted leave to enter or remain

Text.Addition: the student becomes a person with Calais leave;
the student becomes a person with leave to enter or remain as a relevant Afghan citizen

Addition.Addition: or the spouse, civil partner, child or stepchild of such a person

Text.Addition: the student becomes a protected Ukrainian national

Addition.Addition: or the spouse, civil partner, child or stepchild of such a person

Text.Substitution: the student becomes a family member described in paragraph 6A(1)(a), 6C(1)(a)
of Schedule 2;
the student becomes a person described in
of Schedule 2;
where regulation 9(1A)(a) applies,
described in paragraph 8(1)(a) of Schedule 2;

P4para.Text: the student becomes a person described in paragraph 4A(1)(a) of Schedule 2 or, where regulation 9(1A)(a) applies, in paragraph 4(1)(a) of Schedule 2;

Text.Substitution: the student becomes a person described in paragraph 7A(a) of Schedule 2 or, where regulation 9(1A)(a) applies, in paragraph 7(1)(a) of Schedule 2; or

Text.Addition: the student becomes a person described in paragraph 6B(1)(a)(ii) of Schedule 2.

P2para.Text: In this regulation and regulation 81, the following terms have the same meaning as in Schedule 2

Para.Text: family member (aelod o deulu) ...;

Text.Addition: immigration rules (

Para.Text: parent (rhiant);

Term.Substitution: person granted leave to enter or remain as a protected partner
